meanings.def: to use your teeth to cut into or through something
examples: Does your dog bite?
Come here! I won't bite! (= you don't need to be afraid)
bite into/through something She bit into a ripe juicy pear.
bite somebody/something She was bitten by the family dog.
Stop biting your nails!
bite off something/sth off He bit off a large chunk of bread/He bit a large chunk of bread off.
The dog had bitten right through its rope.
He bit at his lower lip.

meanings.def: to wound somebody by making a small hole or mark in their skin
examples: Most European spiders don't bite.
bite somebody We were badly bitten by mosquitoes.

meanings.def: if a fish bites, it takes food from the end of a fishing line and may get caught
to have an unpleasant effect
examples: The recession is beginning to bite.

meanings.def: to develop a strong interest in or enthusiasm for something
examples: He's been bitten by the travel bug.

meanings.def: to start to deal with an unpleasant or difficult situation which cannot be avoided
examples: I wasn’t happy with the way my career was going so I decided to bite the bullet and look for another job.

meanings.def: to fail, or to be defeated or destroyed
examples: Thousands of small businesses bite the dust every year.

meanings.def: to die
to harm somebody who has helped you or supported you
to shout at somebody in an angry way, especially without reason
to stop yourself from saying something or from showing an emotion
examples: I bit my lip and forced myself to be calm.

meanings.def: to try to do too much, or something that is too difficult
to stop yourself from saying something that might upset somebody or cause an argument, although you want to speak
examples: I didn't believe her explanation but I bit my tongue.

meanings.def: alcohol that you drink in order to make you feel better when you have drunk too much alcohol the night before
after an unpleasant experience you are careful to avoid something similar

meanings.def: an act of biting
examples: The dog gave me a playful bite.

meanings.def: the way the upper and lower teeth fit together
examples: He has to wear a brace to correct his bite.

meanings.def: a small piece of food that you can bite from a larger piece
examples: She took a couple of bites of the sandwich.
He didn't eat a bite of his dinner (= he ate nothing).
She tried to talk between bites.
She took a huge bite out of the chocolate bar.

meanings.def: a small amount of food; a small meal
examples: How about a bite of lunch?
We just have time for a bite to eat before the movie.
We managed to grab a bite at the airport.

meanings.def: a wound made by an animal or insect
examples: Dog bites can get infected.
a mosquito/snake/insect bite
a bite from a poisonous snake
There was a bite mark on his arm.

meanings.def: a pleasant strong taste
examples: Cheese will add extra bite to any pasta dish.

meanings.def: a sharp cold feeling
examples: There's a bite in the air tonight.

meanings.def: a quality that makes something effective or powerful
examples: The performance had no bite to it.
The sun had lost some of its bite by then.

meanings.def: the act of a fish biting food on a hook
examples: The fishermen waited all afternoon for a bite.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody is not really as angry or as aggressive as they sound
an opportunity to do something
examples: You only get one bite at the cherry in life.
They were eager for a second bite of the cherry.
